title: Windows XP x64 Rufus Edition with vista orb and theme (and DX10)
description:
This is my operating system: Windows XP x64 Edition, with a modified uxtheme patch and a vista theme. Indistinguishable from vista. Boots fast, runs fast, fully updated to Servicepack 2.

This replaces my torrent previously advertised (March 10th 2008)
This is a working ISO from my bootable CD.

This runs on AMD64 and Intel EM64T - *any* 64-bit capable CPU can run this.

All the good-looks of Windows Vista without the sluggish performance!


Built from the same codebase as Server2K3, so fully supports SATA and RAID.

Quad core and Dual-processor fully supported. 

RAM supported up to 128GB

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Screenshots here:  <a href=" http://s218.photobucket.com/albums/cc305/RufusThorne/xp64/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://s218.photobucket.com/albums/cc305/RufusThorne/xp64/</a>
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



Features added by me that sets it apart from regular x64 Edition:


* Vista start orb and theme
* Vista aero icons and mouse cursors
* Hundreds of Wallpapers
* Fully 64-bit additional software from around the web
* Volume License Key, passes all WGA checks
* Direct X 10 :-)

yes the DX10 is *real* - in the archive not on the ISO.
Just ignore the Polish and run it. Guaranteed no problems.



Drivers & Software included on disc (all 64-bit) :

- LOOK IN THE DRIVERS & EXTRAS FOLDERS ON THE CD! -

ATI Catalyst 8.3 Drivers (5th March 2008)
Toshiba Bluetooth Stack
Realtek HD Audio 2.11.15
RAlink Wireless network card driver
.NET Framework 1.1 and 2.0
DirectX 9.0c - March 2008

GhostWall Firewall
Microsoft Virtual PC 2007
Media Player 11
Windows Defender
TweakUI-64
Avast! Antivirus

187 Spectacular Wallpapers


NVIDIA users will need to grab drivers from the nvidia site, as I have an ATI card and this release is tailored especially for my needs. The vista theme should work fine for everyone.


I am Rufus Thorne and my copy of XP x64 shits all over Vista!
